name: Alon Zakai
text: Unlike [pre-existing languages, AssemblyScript] is designed with WebAssembly and code size in mind. It's not an existing language that we are using for a new purpose but it's a language designed for [WebAssembly]. It has great wasm-opt integration, in fact it's built with it, and it's very easy to get good code size.
title: Shipping Tiny WebAssembly Builds (WebAssembly Summit)

name: Surma
text: You are now able to write WebAssembly, without learning a new language, and harness all these benefits WebAssembly might offer you. I think that is kind of powerful. AssemblyScript is absolutely usable, and very enjoyable!
title: WebAssembly for Web Developers (Google I/O â€™19)

name: Colin Eberhardt
text: I do think [compiling TypeScript into WASM] is tremendously useful. It allows JavaScript developers to create WASM modules without having to learn C!
title: Exploring different approaches to building WebAssembly modules (Scott Logic)
